idea-plugin.name: Shutdown Tasks
idea-plugin.description:
Shutdown Tasks

Execute run configurations automatically when closing a project or IDE - the mirror feature of IntelliJ's built-in "Startup Tasks".

Features

  • Automated Execution: Run configured run/debug configuration on project close
  • Task Management: Add, remove, edit and reorder tasks with an intuitive UI
  • Visual Feedback: Progress dialog shows current task execution and elapsed time
  • Sequential Execution: Tasks run in the order you define
  • Configurable Timeout: Set timeout per task (1-300 seconds)

Important

⚠️ Shell Script tasks must not have "Execute in the terminal" selected.

Use Cases

  • Stop development servers or background processes
  • Run cleanup scripts to remove temporary files
  • Commit, stash or push code automatically
  • Execute deployment or build tasks
  • Close connections and release resources

Configuration

Configure shutdown tasks in Settings → Tools → Shutdown Tasks
